item.title: The Destruction of NASA Would Be a Blow to Our Collective Imagination
item.description: As NASA grapples with major proposed budget cuts and losing some of its most brilliant minds, America’s willingness to look outward is also at risk.

item.title: I Went to an AI Film Festival Screening and Left With More Questions Than Answers
item.description: Runway AI paired up with Imax to screen 10 AI-generated winning selections. The festival has been derided by some cinephiles, while others insist it’s part of a natural technological evolution.

item.title: Roblox’s New Age Verification Feature Uses AI to Scan Teens’ Video Selfies
item.description: Roblox will scan video selfies of teens to assess their ages as part of a new Trusted Connections feature that gives users access to unfiltered chatting with people they know.

item.title: Synths hunt down deadly monsters in latest Alien: Earth trailer
item.description: “This ship collected specimens. Five new life forms from distant planets. Monsters.”

item.title: Fanfic study challenges leading cultural evolution theory
item.description: Fanfic community craves familiarity much more than novelty—but reports greater enjoyment from novelty.

item.title: Linda Hamilton rocks Stranger Things’ S5 extended teaser
item.description: “After what we’ve been through, it ties us together. Forever.”

item.title: How Social Media Is Fueling Gen Z’s Sex Recession
item.description: For her new book, journalist Carter Sherman interviewed over 100 young people about why they’re not having sex. She says they’re “very horny” but also more isolated, self-conscious, and fearful.

item.title: How Social Media Is Fueling Gen Z’s Sex Recession

item.title: Medieval preacher invoked chivalric hero as a meme in sermon
item.description: “This is very early evidence of a preacher weaving pop culture into a sermon to keep his audience hooked.”

item.title: Species at 30 makes for a great guilty pleasure
item.description: Sure, the plot lacks originality but it’s a solid B movie—and H.R. Giger designed the alien lifeform.

item.title: These LGBTQ+ Archives Defy Erasure, One Memory at a Time
item.description: In Latin America, LGBTQ+ history collections are a form of resistance. Grassroots projects are using the memories of community members to fight against systematic violence and demand justice.

item.title: Review: Stellar cast makes Superman shine bright
item.description: James Gunn’s entertaining reboot has a few flaws but so much heart—and wow, that stellar cast.
